name: Cavalieri Hotel

reviews.text: We have been to Malta many times but this was our first stay at the Cavalieri and we would definitely return! The location was superb with many of our favourite restaurants and bars just a short walk away and the chance to walk past the cat village every day! The hotel itself was excellent. The rooms were large and comfortable with a lovely sea view and great facilities. It was lovely to be able to make a coffee in the room before and after breakfast. The minibar had space to fit a pint of milk and some juice in as well which was handy! We also found the free safe convenient and easy to use. The breakfast was excellent with one of the best choices i've seen. The made to order omelettes were particularly good, as were a lot of the healthy options. We also used the hotel bar which was very reasonably priced for a 4* hotel- 0nly €12 for 3 glasses of wine and a pint of Cisk! We travelled in January and it was quite cold out but we used the indoor pool every morning and it was lovely-nicely heated! All in all an ideal hotel!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay
Don't listen to "moaning Minnies"
reviews.text: I can only assume that some people get some sort of perverse pleasure out of slagging off hotels. Well of course anybody can find fault in certain areas and if that is what you want to do with your time on holiday well the best of luck to you. Personally I had a great time from the moment I arrived. Room overlooking the bay was excellent, chambermaids smiley and kept the room nice and clean. Breakfast excellent, plenty of choice. I did ask the manager one morning why I could only plug in the television or the fridge at one time he replied with a big smile on his face "which would you prefer" we both laughed and he sorted it within ten minutes. Pool area is a sun trap all day long. Ed the barman is a star, great service and lots of magic tricks. All in all a great hotel, definitely would go back

Very good hotel,I enjoyed my stay here in jan,request a high floor to be away from street noise if you are not paying for a bay view,but be aware that unless you do have a bay view you will not be getting the sun.food in restaurant is good,plenty of choice.bar is excellent and the outside smoking area is extremely comfortable with nice seating area and patio heater in a marquee type construction.free wifi in reception and bar area.although the hotel has a fantastic position for views and catching the sun,it is at the end of a long road which is in places quite uneven and steep which if your fit and healthy is no problem but not good for the less mobile.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel,fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My other half and I had a wonderful week at the Cavalieri in Malta. We looked forward every morning to our breakfast - and got very excited if the pancake station was operating! The hotel is in a quiet area, but the perfect location for bars and restaurants as everything was in walking distance. All the rooms have a sea view which was also a bonus. Our only criticism was that the reception staff, although very friendly, didn't always know the answers to some of our basic questions. For example, what bus we would need to get to a certain tourist site. We spent one day travelling for 3 hours on 3 different buses after being given the wrong information. Having said that - we had a wonderful week and would definately stay there again if we returned to Malta.
reviews.title: Smiles in Saint Julian's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 7nights early Feb the weather was cold for that time of year in Malta so everyone said, however the air con/heating in the bedroom was efficient, also duvets were in the wardrobe so warm and cosy at night. Our room was at the front therefore facing the road and on the 2nd floor so early morning noise from delivery vans can disturb light sleepers.
reviews.title: 2nd visit

reviews.text: Bathroom was absolutely filthy, all air vents completely covered with dirt. The bedding was at least a decade old and paper thin. Mattresses are hostel quality at best. Although breakfast was included with the room it had no flavor whatsoever. Stayed here only one night because I arrived at 10 PM and was exhausted. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE.
reviews.title: disgusting

reviews.text: We have just returned from Cavalieri and were very pleased with our deal. The hotel is in a great spot with a lovely sun terrace with views across Spinola Bay at the front and views over Portomaso Marina to the rear. Our room had a balcony overlooking marina and we paid £32 per night for the room through Travel Republic which included breakfast. Breakfast was great, all the typical fry up stuff, cereals, pastries, fruit etc and some mornings there was an omelette or pancake chef. We didn't try the hotel restaurants in the evening but other guests that we spoke to seemed pleased with them as a lot of people were staying long term half board through winter. Location is 2 mins walk from the restaurants of St Julians and 5 mins walk to the livelier nightlife of Paceville. There is a bus stop at the top of the street with regular service to Sliema, Bugibba & Valletta. We paid 2.60 euros each return to Valletta and buses are very frequent. We only had a drink in the hotel bar one night as it closed quite early, but this is maybe dependent on how busy it is. Drinks were more expensive than in resort (2.50 euros for half a lager) but not excessive for hotel prices if you wanted a quiet night and the bar does overlook the bay. Rooms were clean and the staff were pleasant. I would happily stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely views & good value

reviews.text: Stayed at the Cavalieri hotel early January, I was apprensive after reading the reveiws, but need not have been as every thing was great.

reviews.text: The check in paper work was swift, was told the room would not be ready until 1430 that was no problem, nice views whilst having a drink. The room allocated to us on the 7th floor over looking the bay had problems, but on reporting them to reception and maintenance failing to fix all the problems we were allocated a room on the 4th floor which had an equally excellent view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought I wrote a review on this ages ago but it never showed up (or else I cant find it!!) Anyway, we stayed at the Cavalieri for our wedding (elsewhere) in Sept 2010. On arrival ours and some of our guests rooms were not ready which wasn't really a big deal as we had lunch while we waited.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: When our room was ready we went up and it was filthy - which was even more shocking seeing as we had to wait an hour for it to be "cleaned"!! It was so obvious that it hadnt been touched - floor was filthy with hairs all over it, hair in the fridge!!! In fairness to them as soon as we called reception and told them the housekeeping supervisor came in and she was raging at the state of the room and got us moved to another room. She was lovely and kept apologising and saying it wasnt good enough. None of our other guests had the same problem - seeing as we were the bride & groom you would imagine they would have made sure the room was clean, we felt we didnt get any extra special treatment - we were promised there would be chamagne & chocolates on arrival for us which there wasnt (bit much to expect I suppose when they couldnt even have a clean room for us!) We said it to the housekeeper though and she said she would arrange it and a few hours later someone came with just the champagne!
reviews.title: The only positive POINT is the price

reviews.text: Also please be aware that they advertise that they have "Queen" size beds in all the rooms - they ARE NOT QUEEN SIZE!!! They are Irish & Uk double size!!! Was really disappointed about that as we have a Queen bed at home and are so used to it plus my husband is over 6ft tall!! Mattresses were really uncomfortable also.
reviews.title: A really nice break in a lovely hotel

reviews.text: There was a huge selection of food for breakfast - one would almost need a map to get around it all!! But as a vegetarian I found the choice was very limited.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again.

description: Hotel offers modern comforts, restaurant and bar; situated at the water's edge; near casino & shopping; 10 miles from MLA airport. Facilities include a spacious pool deck and swimming pool, indoor pool and sauna.
